content:
RegistryOptions Enum

Definition

Specifies options to use when creating a registry key.

In this Article

[System.Flags]
public enum RegistryOptions
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
System.Enum
RegistryOptions

Remarks

You can create a registry key that is available only in memory and that will not be persisted when the computer is restarted. This is known as a volatile key. You can specify that you want to create a volatile or non-volatile key by using the CreateSubKey method overloads that take an options parameter.

Fields

None

A non-volatile key. This is the default.
Volatile

A volatile key. The information is stored in memory and is not preserved when the corresponding registry hive is unloaded.
